DepthSense::Utils::UniqueInstance Class Reference

Class used to detect other running DepthSenseSDK instances. More...

Public Member Functions

bool isAnotherInstanceRunning ()
 Check if another instance is running. More...
 
 UniqueInstance (const char *uniqueName)
 Constructor. More...
 
 ~UniqueInstance ()
 Destructor. More...
 

Detailed Description

Once a UniqueInstance object is created, an attempt to create a global lock is done. At that time, if the lock was already taken by another instance, the lock creation will be aborted and an error flag will be set. This flag can be read using the isAnotherInstanceRunning method. The lock will be released on destruction of the UniqueInstance object.

The Windows and Linux implementations are different. The Windows implementation uses a named global mutex whereas the Linux implementation uses an abstract namespace Unix Domain Socket.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DepthSense::Utils::UniqueInstance::UniqueInstance ( const char *  uniqueName)

Try to take the lock, if it fails a flag indicating that another instance is running is set.

Parameters
uniquename characterizing the lock.
DepthSense::Utils::UniqueInstance::~UniqueInstance ( )

If the lock was taken, release it
